intro: Jaltomata pallascana, commonly known as the Pallascana groundcherry, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and eggplants. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange fruits that resemble cherry tomatoes, often enclosed in a leafy calyx. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats at high elevations. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
